text:
Arthur Dion "A.D." Hanna (born 7 March 1928) is a Bahamian politician. He served as Governor-General of the Bahamas from 2006 to 2011.
In 1984, Hanna resigned his post as Deputy Prime Minister in protest at the retention by Prime Minister Sir Lynden Pindling.
He retired on 14 April 2011 and was succeeded by Sir Arthur Foulkes.
